001package squidpony.squidgrid;
002
003import java.awt.Point;
004import java.util.Deque;
005import java.util.LinkedList;
006import java.util.List;
007
008/**
009 * This class provides methods for calculating Field of View in grids. Field of
010 * View (FOV) algorithms determine how much area surrounding a point can be
011 * seen. They return a two dimensional array of doubles, representing the amount
012 * of view (typically sight, but perhaps sound, smell, etc.) which the origin
013 * has of each cell.
014 *
015 * After a calculation has been run, the resulting light map is saved in the
016 * class. This allows the values to be checked on individual cells without being
017 * required to work with the returned light map. If no calculation has been
018 * performed, all value checking methods will return their version of "unlit".
019 *
020 * The input resistanceMap is considered the percent of opacity. This resistance
021 * is on top of the resistance applied from the light spreading out.
022 *
023 * The returned light map is considered the percent of light in the cells.
024 *
025 * Not all implementations are required to provide percentage levels of light.
026 * In such cases the returned values will be 0 for no light and 1.0 for fully
027 * lit. Implementations that return this way note so in their documentation.
028 *
029 * All solvers perform bounds checking so solid borders in the map are not
030 * required.
031 *
032 * @author Eben Howard - http://squidpony.com - howard@squidpony.com
033 */
034public class FOV {
035
036    public static final int//
037            /**
038             * Performs FOV by pushing values outwards from the source location.
039             * It will go around corners a bit.
040             */
041            RIPPLE = 1,
042            /**
043             * Performs FOV by pushing values outwards from the source location.
044             * It will spread around edges like smoke or water, but maintain a
045             * tendency to curl towards the start position when going around
046             * edges.
047             */
048            RIPPLE_LOOSE = 2,
049            /**
050             * Performs FOV by pushing values outwards from the source location.
051             * It will only go around corners slightly.
052             */
053            RIPPLE_TIGHT = 3,
054            /**
055             * Performs FOV by pushing values outwards from the source location.
056             * It will only go around corners massively.
057             */
058            RIPPLE_VERY_LOOSE = 4,
059            /**
060             * Uses Shadow Casting FOV algorithm. Treats all translucent cells
061             * as fully transparent. Returns only that the cell is fully lit or
062             * not lit, does not do percentages.
063             */
064            SHADOW = 5;
065
066    private double lightMap[][], map[][];
067    private boolean indirect[][];//marks indirect lighting for Ripple FOV
068    private int type = SHADOW;
069    private int rippleNeighbors;
070    private double radius, decay;
071    private int startx, starty, width, height;
072    private Radius radiusStrategy;
073
074    /**
075     * Creates a solver which will use the default SHADOW solver.
076     */
077    public FOV() {
078        lightMap = null;
079        map = null;
080    }
081
082    /**
083     * Creates a solver which will use the provided FOV solver type.
084     *
085     * @param type
086     */
087    public FOV(int type) {
088        this.type = type;
089    }
090
091    /**
092     * Checks to see if the location is considered even partially lit.
093     *
094     * @param x
095     * @param y
096     * @return
097     */
098    public boolean isLit(int x, int y) {
099        return lightLevel(x, y) > 0;
100    }
101
102    /**
103     * Returns the light value at the given location.
104     *
105     * @param x
106     * @param y
107     * @return
108     */
109    public double lightLevel(int x, int y) {
110        if (lightMap == null) {
111            return 0;
112        } else {
113            return lightMap[x][y];
114        }
115    }
116
117    /**
118     * Returns the initial resistance value at the given point. If no
119     * calculation has yet been run, it returns 0.
120     *
121     * @param x
122     * @param y
123     * @return
124     */
125    public double resistance(int x, int y) {
126        if (map == null) {
127            return 0;
128        } else {
129            return map[x][y];
130        }
131    }
132
133    /**
134     * Calculates the Field Of View for the provided map from the given x, y
135     * coordinates. Returns a light map where the values represent a percentage
136     * of fully lit.
137     *
138     * The starting point for the calculation is considered to be at the center
139     * of the origin cell. Radius determinations based on Euclidean
140     * calculations. The light will be treated as having infinite possible
141     * radius.
142     *
143     * @param resistanceMap the grid of cells to calculate on
144     * @param startx the horizontal component of the starting location
145     * @param starty the vertical component of the starting location
146     * @return the computed light grid
147     */
148    public double[][] calculateFOV(double[][] resistanceMap, int startx, int starty) {
149        return calculateFOV(resistanceMap, startx, starty, Integer.MAX_VALUE);
150    }
151
152    /**
153     * Calculates the Field Of View for the provided map from the given x, y
154     * coordinates. Returns a light map where the values represent a percentage
155     * of fully lit.
156     *
157     * The starting point for the calculation is considered to be at the center
158     * of the origin cell. Radius determinations based on Euclidian
159     * calculations.
160     *
161     * @param resistanceMap the grid of cells to calculate on
162     * @param startx the horizontal component of the starting location
163     * @param starty the vertical component of the starting location
164     * @param radius the distance the light will extend to
165     * @return the computed light grid
166     */
167    public double[][] calculateFOV(double[][] resistanceMap, int startx, int starty, int radius) {
168        return calculateFOV(resistanceMap, startx, starty, radius, Radius.CIRCLE);
169    }
170
171    /**
172     * Calculates the Field Of View for the provided map from the given x, y
173     * coordinates. Returns a light map where the values represent a percentage
174     * of fully lit.
175     *
176     * The starting point for the calculation is considered to be at the center
177     * of the origin cell. Radius determinations are determined by the provided
178     * RadiusStrategy.
179     *
180     * @param resistanceMap the grid of cells to calculate on
181     * @param startx the horizontal component of the starting location
182     * @param starty the vertical component of the starting location
183     * @param radius the distance the light will extend to
184     * @param radiusStrategy provides a means to calculate the radius as desired
185     * @return the computed light grid
186     */
187    public double[][] calculateFOV(double[][] resistanceMap, int startx, int starty, double radius, Radius radiusStrategy) {
188        this.map = resistanceMap;
189        this.startx = startx;
190        this.starty = starty;
191        this.radius = radius;
192        this.radiusStrategy = radiusStrategy;
193        decay = 1.0 / radius;
194
195        width = resistanceMap.length;
196        height = resistanceMap[0].length;
197
198        lightMap = new double[width][height];
199        lightMap[startx][starty] = 1;//make the starting space full power
200
201        switch (type) {
202            case RIPPLE:
203                indirect = new boolean[width][height];
204                rippleNeighbors = 2;
205                doRippleFOV(startx, starty);
206                break;
207            case RIPPLE_LOOSE:
208                indirect = new boolean[width][height];
209                rippleNeighbors = 3;
210                doRippleFOV(startx, starty);
211                break;
212            case RIPPLE_TIGHT:
213                indirect = new boolean[width][height];
214                rippleNeighbors = 1;
215                doRippleFOV(startx, starty);
216                break;
217            case RIPPLE_VERY_LOOSE:
218                indirect = new boolean[width][height];
219                rippleNeighbors = 6;
220                doRippleFOV(startx, starty);
221                break;
222            case SHADOW:
223                for (Direction d : Direction.DIAGONALS) {
224                    shadowCast(1, 1.0, 0.0, 0, d.deltaX, d.deltaY, 0);
225                    shadowCast(1, 1.0, 0.0, d.deltaX, 0, 0, d.deltaY);
226                }
227                break;
228        }
229
230        return lightMap;
231    }
232
233    private void doRippleFOV(int x, int y) {
234        Deque<Point> dq = new LinkedList<>();
235        dq.offer(new Point(x, y));
236        while (!dq.isEmpty()) {
237            Point p = dq.pop();
238            if (lightMap[p.x][p.y] <= 0 || indirect[p.x][p.y]) {
239                continue;//no light to spread
240            }
241
242            for (Direction dir : Direction.OUTWARDS) {
243                int x2 = p.x + dir.deltaX;
244                int y2 = p.y + dir.deltaY;
245                if (x2 < 0 || x2 >= width || y2 < 0 || y2 >= height //out of bounds
246                        || radiusStrategy.radius(startx, starty, x2, y2) >= radius + 1) {//+1 to cover starting tile
247                    continue;
248                }
249
250                double surroundingLight = nearRippleLight(x2, y2);
251                if (lightMap[x2][y2] < surroundingLight) {
252                    lightMap[x2][y2] = surroundingLight;
253                    if (map[x2][y2] < 1) {//make sure it's not a wall
254                        dq.offer(new Point(x2, y2));//redo neighbors since this one's light changed
255                    }
256                }
257            }
258        }
259    }
260
261    private double nearRippleLight(int x, int y) {
262        if (x == startx && y == starty) {
263            return 1;
264        }
265
266        List<Point> neighbors = new LinkedList<>();
267        for (Direction di : Direction.OUTWARDS) {
268            int x2 = x + di.deltaX;
269            int y2 = y + di.deltaY;
270            if (x2 >= 0 && x2 < width && y2 >= 0 && y2 < height) {
271                neighbors.add(new Point(x2, y2));
272            }
273        }
274
275        if (neighbors.isEmpty()) {
276            return 0;
277        }
278
279        while (neighbors.size() > rippleNeighbors) {
280            Point p = neighbors.remove(0);
281            double dist = radiusStrategy.radius(startx, starty, p.x, p.y);
282            double dist2 = 0;
283            for (Point p2 : neighbors) {
284                dist2 = Math.max(dist2, radiusStrategy.radius(startx, starty, p2.x, p2.y));
285            }
286            if (dist < dist2) {//not the largest, put it back
287                neighbors.add(p);
288            }
289        }
290
291        double light = 0;
292        int lit = 0, indirects = 0;
293        for (Point p : neighbors) {
294            if (lightMap[p.x][p.y] > 0) {
295                lit++;
296                if (indirect[p.x][p.y]) {
297                    indirects++;
298                }
299                double dist = radiusStrategy.radius(x, y, p.x, p.y);
300                light = Math.max(light, lightMap[p.x][p.y] - dist * decay - map[p.x][p.y]);
301            }
302        }
303
304        if (map[x][y] >= 1 || indirects >= lit) {
305            indirect[x][y] = true;
306        }
307        return light;
308    }
309
310    private void shadowCast(int row, double start, double end, int xx, int xy, int yx, int yy) {
311        double newStart = 0;
312        if (start < end) {
313            return;
314        }
315
316        boolean blocked = false;
317        for (int distance = row; distance <= radius && !blocked; distance++) {
318            int deltaY = -distance;
319            for (int deltaX = -distance; deltaX <= 0; deltaX++) {
320                int currentX = startx + deltaX * xx + deltaY * xy;
321                int currentY = starty + deltaX * yx + deltaY * yy;
322                double leftSlope = (deltaX - 0.5f) / (deltaY + 0.5f);
323                double rightSlope = (deltaX + 0.5f) / (deltaY - 0.5f);
324
325                if (!(currentX >= 0 && currentY >= 0 && currentX < this.width && currentY < this.height) || start < rightSlope) {
326                    continue;
327                } else if (end > leftSlope) {
328                    break;
329                }
330
331                //check if it's within the lightable area and light if needed
332                if (radiusStrategy.radius(deltaX, deltaY) <= radius) {
333                    double bright = 1 - decay * radiusStrategy.radius(deltaX, deltaY);
334                    lightMap[currentX][currentY] = bright;
335                }
336
337                if (blocked) { //previous cell was a blocking one
338                    if (map[currentX][currentY] >= 1) {//hit a wall
339                        newStart = rightSlope;
340                    } else {
341                        blocked = false;
342                        start = newStart;
343                    }
344                } else {
345                    if (map[currentX][currentY] >= 1 && distance < radius) {//hit a wall within sight line
346                        blocked = true;
347                        shadowCast(distance + 1, start, leftSlope, xx, xy, yx, yy);
348                        newStart = rightSlope;
349                    }
350                }
351            }
352        }
353    }
354}
